messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Dates w/ hubby
messages.msgSnippet: over the yrs, we ve done the same thing ... if the kidlets couldn t go w/ us someplace then we PROB didn t need to be going ... dh travels so much and when
messages.messageBody:
over the yrs, we've done the same thing ... if the kidlets couldn't go w/ us
someplace then we PROB didn't need to be going ... dh travels so much and
when he's home he *LOATHES* leaving the kids and so do I ... so, we've just
always packed everyone up and taken them w/ us; no biggie ... and, after 24
yrs (married 28 yrs), it's worked and no regrets <G>

Pris
WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my cats
have learned how to type ...


----- Original Message -----
From: "Kim" <sinclai@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 4:21 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Dates w/ hubby

> Hi Amy and Julie et. al.,
> My girls are older now and can stay home by themselves, but my DH and I
> still don't go on very many 'dates'! About the closest we get to a date
is
> going to the movie theatre and letting the girls see their own movie while
> DH and I see ours!!! I think the whole time my girls were little we left
> them about 4 times with a sitter! Our dates were much like Amy's, rushed
> and conversation was only about the children! They are 14 and 10 now!
But
> I always liked being with my girls and I still do!!! We did get a kind of
a
> break (I don't think it could be called a date) when we went looking for a
> car! They didn't want to go!
> Kim

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Dates w/ hubby
messages.msgSnippet: kim, it is a nice peek into the future....thanks.... Julie- with a 3yr and 1yr and little time alone with hubby!
messages.messageBody:
kim,
it is a nice peek into the future....thanks....

Julie- with a 3yr and 1yr and little time alone with hubby!

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Dates w/ hubby
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Amy and Julie et. al., My girls are older now and can stay home by themselves, but my DH and I still don t go on very many dates !  About the closest we
messages.messageBody:
Hi Amy and Julie et. al.,
My girls are older now and can stay home by themselves, but my DH and I
still don't go on very many 'dates'! About the closest we get to a date is
going to the movie theatre and letting the girls see their own movie while
DH and I see ours!!! I think the whole time my girls were little we left
them about 4 times with a sitter! Our dates were much like Amy's, rushed
and conversation was only about the children! They are 14 and 10 now! But
I always liked being with my girls and I still do!!! We did get a kind of a
break (I don't think it could be called a date) when we went looking for a
car! They didn't want to go!
Kim


Date: Tue, 5 Sep 2000 16:33:17 EDT
> From: Jaam1224@...
> Subject: Re: Re: Dates w/ hubby
>
> In a message dated 9/5/00 4:29:29 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
> aworthen@... writes:
>
> << my dh and I have been having negotations on
> > leaving the children to go on a dinner date. While I would love to
spend
> > some time alone with my hubby, I am not will to sacrafice my childrens
> > happiness or security to do it.
>
> So are you goin? <g>. Dh and I just had our first date in 3 years. It
> actually felt akward. We ate really fast, and rushed home to the kids.
LOL
> Amy
> Mom to Samantha, Dana, and Casey
>
> P.S. And we talked about the kids the whole time. LOL
>
> >>
> still trying to work on a compromise!
>
> Julie-LOL because if we do go, I am sure out "date" will be the same way!
>
